description: From Latin scurrīlis (“buffoon-like”), from scurra (“a buffoon”). Doublet of scurrile.

adjectives.description: scurrilous (comparative more scurrilous, superlative most scurrilous)

entries.meaning: (of a person) Given to vulgar verbal abuse; foul-mouthed.
(of language) Coarse, vulgar, abusive, or slanderous.

examples: We have had our address used by scurrilous crooks in the past to gain assets by fraud.
